cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.DS, cs.GT, cs.IT. 

The paper deals with randomized algorithms for multiarmed bandits, which is a classic problem in machine learning and optimization. The paper proposes a new strategy for gap estimation and combines it with the EXP3++ algorithm, which is a well-known algorithm for multiarmed bandits. Therefore, the paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of "Machine Learning" (cs.LG) and "Artificial Intelligence" (cs.AI). The paper also involves the analysis of the algorithm's performance, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-category of "Data Structures and Algorithms" (cs.DS) and "Game Theory" (cs.GT). Finally, the paper mentions the use of information theory in the analysis, which suggests that it may also belong to the sub-category of "Information Theory" (cs.IT).
